description: Back-formation from stridulation. (From earlier term stridulous; from Latin strīdulus (“giving a shrill sound, creaking”), from strīdō (“utter a shrill or harsh sound; creak, shriek, grate, hiss”))

verbs.description: stridulate (third-person singular simple present stridulates, present participle stridulating, simple past and past participle stridulated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To make a high-pitched chirping, grating, hissing, or squeaking sound, as male crickets and grasshoppers do, by rubbing certain body parts together.
examples: A window was open, and the crickets were stridulating at an ominous speed in the black motionless foliage.
